bug.author: ldmtwo
bug.description: The makefile does not find all MKL libraries. It fails with finding libiomp5.* (liomp5 flag). I fixed this by copying these to a used path, but it should be fixed by searching for the correct path. As an example for intel64 on Xeon: MISSING_INTEL64_LIBS=$(find /opt/intel/compilers_and_libraries*/linux/compiler/lib/intel64_lin) Repeat for MIC and IA32

comments.comment: Thanks for reporting the issue. We are looking into it.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ldmtwo>@ldmtwo</denchmark-link> , as of today, CNTK supports MKL through a CNTK custom MKL library, which should also fix this error. Updated set up instructions are provided here, specifically in the section on "MKL": <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Microsoft/CNTK/wiki/Setup-CNTK-on-Linux>https://github.com/Microsoft/CNTK/wiki/Setup-CNTK-on-Linux</denchmark-link>
(and for Windows here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Microsoft/CNTK/wiki/Setup-CNTK-on-Windows>https://github.com/Microsoft/CNTK/wiki/Setup-CNTK-on-Windows</denchmark-link> ) Hope this helps, and please let us know if there's still an issue, Mark
